Interface ec.util.Orderable

public interface interface Orderable
This interface is for objects which may be ordered with respect to each other. It is of particular use to PriorityQueues, which require their elements to all be instances of Orderable.

See Also:
PriorityQueue

compare(Orderable)
Return one of -1, 0, or 1 to indicate that this object is less than, equal to, or greater than, the given object

compare 
 public abstract int compare(Orderable obj) throws UnorderedException
Return one of -1, 0, or 1 to indicate that this object is less than, equal to, or greater than, the given object

Parameters:
obj - the object to compare to
Returns:
the comparison result
Throws: UnorderedException
thrown if this object isn't ordered with respect to the given object
